content: The Act, known as the "Helping Ensure Life- and Limb-saving access to Podiatric Physicians Act" or the "HELLPP Act," recognizes doctors of podiatric medicine as physicians under the Medicaid program. The "HELLPP Act" amends the Social Security Act to include podiatric physicians as physicians under Medicaid. The amendment regarding services furnished on or after January 1, 2018, applies unless state legislation is required for compliance. The "HELLPP Act" amends the Social Security Act to include podiatric physicians as physicians under Medicaid. States must comply with the new requirements before the first day of the first calendar quarter after the state legislature's regular session following the Act's enactment. Each year of a 2-year legislative session is considered a separate regular session. SEC. 3. CLARIFYING MEDICARE DOCUMENTATION REQUIREMENTS FOR THERAPEUTIC SHOES FOR PERSONS WITH DIABETES. Section 1861(s)(12) of the Social Security Act is amended to allow for therapeutic shoes for individuals with diabetes, under certain conditions specified by the managing physician. The Social Security Act allows for therapeutic shoes for individuals with diabetes if prescribed by a qualified physician and deemed medically necessary. The physician must examine the individual, determine the medical necessity, and communicate this to a certifying doctor for approval. The amendment applies to items and services furnished on or after January 1, 2018, and does not expand Medicare coverage for therapeutic shoes for individuals with diabetes. SEC. 4. BUDGET SAVINGS: STRENGTHENING MEDICAID PROGRAM INTEGRITY THROUGH CONTINUOUS LEVY ON PAYMENTS TO MEDICAID PROVIDERS AND SUPPLIERS. Amends the Internal Revenue Code to include payments to Medicaid providers or suppliers under a State plan. Effective for levies issued after the enactment of this Act.
